resources.string:
OSMECON MedQuiz is the biggest and most sought-after quiz of it’s kind in India!

How many of us find the hours of reading the drab books filled to the brim with stuff we have to remember…umm, boring? To jump to interesting and the very interesting bits, wait no longer for here is this quiz which brings it all to you. If you thought information could never be entertainment, you haven’t seen the OSMECON MedQuiz!

Knowing your Gray’s and Guyton’s, Harrison’s and Robbin’s, Parsons’ and Park (!) cover to cover will not be enough. In fact, all that is not even needed. Come with a healthy 1.5 gooey chunk in your head, and an all-round awareness of the world of medicine. Finalist or not, we bet you’ll go home loving medicine more than before. Follow our Facebook page for questions from previous editions.

The earlier editions drew an amazing feedback for the quality of questions and the quizzing. This year’s edition promises to be better, bigger, tougher and more competitive. First years have beaten final years before, yes! – the smartest ones, not necessarily the nerdiest, walk away with a very handsome prize. An overload of prizes for all finalists as well. You just can’t miss the quiz!

OSMECON is a pan India Undergraduate Medical Conference conducted annually by Osmania Medical College and its associate hospitals Designed as a special platform presented by Osmania Medical College to promote undergraduate talent, it instils scientific reasoning and reinforces the value of medical research. Started in 2010 to share medical research done by undergraduates, OSMECON has grown to a special event to showcase, learn, share and gain knowledge. OSMECON has leaped from humble beginnings to involving over 500 young medicos last year This year it’s only set to get bigger and better!

Osmania Medical College originally Hyderabad Medical College is a medical college in Hyderabad and is often ranked among the best medical colleges in the nation. It is listed among the Avicenna directory of medical schools and the FAIMER IMED directory It was founded in 1846 as the Hyderabad Medical School making it one of the oldest medical schools in the world.It is presently affiliated to the NTR University of Health Sciences. It has more than 10 teaching hospitals and several outreach hospitals affiliated to it and has a high reputation as a centre of clinical excellence. Osmania Medical College has long been a government institution in Andhra Pradesh. It is the oldest medical school in India and perhaps Asia. The concept of Osmania Medical College dates back to 1595 AD, then called as Dar-Ul-Shifa in Hyderabad, making it the oldest medical school. 
Osmania has a rich history of pioneering medical innovations For the first time, chloroform was used as an anaesthetic in Osmania. The causative agent of malaria was elucidated here by Sir Ronald Ross who has been immortalised by the Sir Ronald Ross Institute of Tropical and Communicable Diseases affiliated to Osmania Medical College. Osmania is the only medical college in India where each medical specialty has a separate training hospital which comes to an overall bed count of over 6000 beds. 
The following hospitals fulfil the role of teaching hospitals for Osmania Medical College.

1. Osmania General Hospital
2. Government Maternity Hospital
3. Niloufer Hospital
4. Sir Ronald Ross Institute of Tropical and Communicable Diseases
5. Modern Government Maternity Hospital, Petlaburz
6. Mehdi Nawaz Jung Institute of Oncology
7. Sarojini Devi Eye Hospital
8. Government ENT Hospital
9. The Institute of Mental Health
10. Government Chest Hospital
11. Rural Health Centre Patancheru – Osmania is one of the only two medical colleges in India with a rural health centre attached to it.

Abdul Kareem - Web and Graphics
Satya Revanth - Video

Sana Hyder
Samatha Toopran
Pooja Kalantri
G. Sri Vibhavari
Rahul Myadam

"In trifling show his tinsel talent lies,
And form the want of intellects supplies,
In aspect grand and goodly he appears,
Rever’d as patriarchs in primaeval years.
Hourly his learn’d impertinence affords
A barren superfluity of words,
The patient’s ears remorselessly he assails,
Murders with jargon where his med’cine fails.”

Still apt are these lines by Sir Samuel Garth (1661 – 1719), English physician and poet, revealing the obvious shortcomings of medical knowledge and those seeking to use it. Despite there being several areas beyond our understanding, we can still valiantly, albeit naively, try and catch up with the unknown rather than letting it get too far ahead.

Searching and researching the annals of medicine and learning by experience with a touch of imaginative brilliance alongside can go a long way in unraveling the medical mysteries.

What better way to do it than with fellow students and future professionals in one of the more well-known medical institutes in the country!

Room No.: 140,
Osmecon Secretariat,
Osmania Medical College,
Turrebaz Khan Road,
Koti,
Hyderabad- 500001

The closest train station is at Hyderabad Deccan-HYB (Nampally) which is 2 kilometres away. It is considered the best to board or arrive from out state destination trains in Hyderabad. Other important railway stations in Hyderabad include Secunderabad/ Kachiguda/Begumpet Railway stations.
Rajiv Gandhi International Airport (ranked among the top airports of the world ) is located 23 kilometres away from Osmania Medical College Car rental and Taxi services are available at the airport.

1. Each team can have up to 2 members.

2. There is no restriction on team composition. You can team up with any UG student of any college of any year i.e cross college teams are allowed.

3. There will first be a prelims for all the participating teams from which 8 teams will move on to the finals.

4. The quiz will have big cash prizes for the top 3 places and also all finalists. So don’t think much, just participate!

5. For any queries, contact +91 9848608706

Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station (the largest in Asia) located close to Koti is a major bus station, and it is a road transport gateway to the city. This bus station provides transport to all parts of the state and country. The local city Bus terminus is located adjacent to the Mahatma Bus station, providing connectivity to all parts of the city.

This is an amazing platform for young researchers to showcase their research. Research done by undergraduates in any medical field is accepted. The abstracts would be reviewed by specific panels and short-listed for presentation.

1. This category includes research papers done by undergraduate medical students.

2. This category is open to students of all years, i.e., 1st year to house surgeons.

3. Only individual projects will be accepted.

4. Both funded and non-funded projects will be accepted.

5. The abstract should include the Title, Introduction (including objectives), Material and Methods, Results and Conclusion, and should not exceed 300 words.

6. The final presentation document should be submitted after receiving intimation regarding selection of an abstract.

7. The final presentation should be as the student would be presenting it at the Conference, i.e., a 9 minute presentation (7 minutes for presentation and 2 minutes for questioning). It should be mailed only as a Microsoft Power Point (.ppt, .pps, .pptx or .ppsx), or PDF document. Please bring any Video files you have added in the PPT as separate files too. Preferred video format is Windows Media Video (.wmv).

8. Submissions that do not fulfil all the above mentioned criteria will be rejected.
Selection will be done by an evaluation team of senior faculty members.\n\nExciting Cash Prizes along with certificates will be awarded to the winners.
An excellent platform to share any interesting case you might have seen with peers in your fraternity. If you have one then what\'s the delay , send it across to us.

1. This category includes clinical cases encountered by undergraduate medical students during their clinical rotation.

2. This category is open to students of 2nd year to house surgeons.

3. Both individual and group (group of 2 members) presentations are welcome. In case of group presentation, only one of the authors will be presenting. Both the delegates need to answer at the time of questioning.

4. The students have to submit the Case Abstract/Summary while submitting their abstract.

5. The case summary should include title, patient particulars, history, examination, differential diagnosis, investigations, treatment, prognosis and follow up and should not exceed 250 words.

6. The completed case report document should be submitted after receiving intimation regarding selection of the case.

7. The completed case report should be as the students would be presenting it at the conference, i.e., an 8 minute presentation (6 minutesfor presentation and 2 minutes for questioning). Timings will be strictly followed.

8. The students are required to add at the end of the PowerPoint document a photograph of the front page of the patientâ€™s case sheet in which the name of the patient, date of admission and hospital name are clearly visible. This is to ensure that the student is presenting a case encountered by him/her at their respective hospitals only. Background checks may be done to confirm this.

9. The case should be mailed only as a Microsoft Power Point (.ppt, .pps, .pptx or .ppsx), or PDF document. Please bring any Video files you have added in the PPT as separate files too. Preferred video format is Windows Media Video (.wmv).

10. Submissions that do not fulfil all the above mentioned criteria may be rejected.

Selection will be done by an evaluation team of senior faculty members.

Exciting Cash Prizes along with certificates will be awarded to the winners.

In case of a group presentation both the participants need to register separately. Both the Delegates need to submit the same Case Title and Co-Presenter details.


 N.B.: A clinical discussion is better appreciated than theoretical approach.
Gain and spread knowledge about the most happening topics in the field of medicine.

1. This category includes posters made by undergraduate medical students on a chosen topic.

2. This category is open to students of all years, i.e., 1st year to house surgeons.

3. Both individual and group (maximum of 3 members) presentations are welcome. In case of group presentation, all the students of the group are required to present the poster.

4. At least one delegate is expected to be present at the poster to explain and clarify queries even at free time

5. The poster should not exceed the dimensions of 1.2m (Horizontal) x 1.0m (Vertical). (This is the maximum wall area provided for each poster).

6. Choose a good title. You may talk on present and future scenarios. Try being unique.

7. The time given for poster presentation will be 5 minutes. (3 min. Presentation + 2 min. Questionnaire)

8. The poster may be hand-made or computer-printed.

9. Submissions that do not fulfil all the above mentioned criteria will be rejected.

30 posters (total) will be given space at the conference.

Posters will be accepted on first-come-first-serve basis.

In case of Group Presentations, all participants should register separately and enter the same Poster Topic and Co-Presenter details.
Train yourself in the art of saving lives at crucial moments through experts in the field. Join us in this American Heart Association (AHA ) accredited workshop.
ABCs to save a New Born

Neonatal Intensive Care Units is off limits for an undergraduate. Here you get a chance to virtually be there. In collaboration with National Neonatal Forum (NNF), Neonatal Resuscitation is a premier event brought to you by OSMECON.
Equip yourself with the skills to perform a delivery!
Get a hands-on experience in the management of labour and how to manage any complications that may arise while delivering a baby.

Surgical Skills:
Hands-on experience in the basics of Surgery, taught by experts. A route for amateurs to gain expertise.

ECG:
Diagnose cardiovascular emergencies right away by interpreting an ECG! The ECG workshop is certified by Indian Institute of Emergency Medical Services (IIEMS). Participants will learn how to take an ECG along with the basics of electrophysiology.
Hands-on experience in the basics of Surgery, taught by experts. A route for amateurs to gain expertise

“I love argument, I love debate. I don’t expect anyone just to sit there and agree with me, that’s not their job.”

~ Margaret Thatcher


They say it is better to debate a question without settling it than to settle a question without debating it. The world of medicine has only grown with dissent, disputes and debates. We have come a long way from the original meaning of the word debate, ‘to fight’; the fight is now more intellectual than physical. Those of you with verbal mastery, flawless logic and a knack of persuasion, now move over your Facebook debates, Twitter wars and armchair activism. Come and convince us at the Debate in OSEMCON ’14!


Topic: Can AYUSH be incorporated into Modern Medicine?

1. Debate is NOT a team event.
2. Participants are expected to put forward their point of view either for or against the notion.
3. Prior registration is preferable. On the spot entries are also accepted.
4. Participants are encouraged to research the topic thoroughly.
5. Exciting cash prizes await the best speakers.

• In the screening round all the participants would be allowed to present their views either for or against the notion for 2 minutes each.
• The best speakers from each side move on to the next round.
• Each speaker will get 3 minutes to elaborate their views and face questions by the judges and audience.
• Following this, all these speakers will also get rebuttal time.

Topic: Mental Health- Changing Minds, Changing Lives

What is your version of the perfect mental health? How, according to you, can we stay mentally fit? Are there, in your perspective, any subtle signs of mental illness in our day to day lives? What do you think is limiting our mental well-being? Are we ready to break the stigma that currently clouds our outlook towards the mentally unalike? OSMECON looks to you to come up with out of the box photographs to relieve us from our box-less floundering on this issue!

Showcase your talent by capturing anything from illness to breaking the stigma associated with it.


Photography Guidelines:

1. All entries should be sent to photography@osmecon.org.

2. Each participant can send as many photos as he/she likes.

3. The photos must be sent in .jpg format only.

4. You can include a caption to add perspective to your photo. Type the Caption in the email for each photo (e.g. Caption for Photo 1: xyz, Caption for Photo 2: abc)

5. The email should also contain the following information: ‘PARTICIPANT’S NAME’, ‘INSTITUTE’, ‘UNIQUE REGISTRATION ID’ and ‘Contact Number’.

6. Each entry should be an original work and should not defame anybody nor violate any copyright.

7. The organizing committee reserves the right to disqualify an entry at any point of time in the contest if there is a violation of the above mentioned rules.
Delegates would be given an hour to write an essay on our theme. Best write up will be awarded an Exciting Cash Prize along with an Appreciation Certificate and will go into OSMECON\'s Wall of Fame.

A picture is worth a thousand words. Then how many words would a movie be worth? Express your message through a short film and use our platform to promote it.

Short Film Guidelines

1. The concept of the short film should be medically relevant.

2. The short film should not exceed 15 minutes in length including credits.

3. English subtitles are mandatory irrespective of the language of short film. Applicants can give as many films as they wish.

4. Any clipping involving drug abuse, smoking, alcohol, can be shown only if required for awareness /educational purposes and if shown, a disclaimer is MANDATORY.

Coz actions speak louder than words. Stop, think, ask, act

Are you a master of silent speech? This one's different. Come n let's play

It's fun being dumb!

Topic for painting will be based on our theme. 45 minutes are allotted. Best painting will be awarded an Exciting Cash Prize along with an Appreciation Certificate and will go into OSMECON\'s Wall of Fame.\n\n
Gain and spread knowledge about the most happening topics in the field of medicine.
Topic of the Poster will be updated soon.
30 posters (total) will be given space at the conference.
Posters will be accepted on first-come-first-serve basis.
Train yourself in the art of saving lives at crucial moments through experts in the field.
ABCs to save a New Born

1. All the delegates need to register for the conference.

2. Unique Registration ID will be mailed on registration. Kindly note the Unique ID for future references.

3. Please select the events which interest you. Preferences can be updated after registration but please try to make the initial attempt as the final one.

4. Registration process does not include any payment. Payment should be done only after your registration is confirmed.

5. Delegates can upload their abstract in the registration form itself. Please read the respective guidelines before submitting the abstract.

6. Last date for registration is 05.08.2014.

7. Registration does not mean allotment of the seat for any event for any registrant. Final list will be selectedbased on merit by a team of Faculty members for Case and Paper. Selection for Workshops and Poster is on first-come first-serve basis.

8. Individual intimation will not be sent upon selection. Please visit our Website/Facebook page for the final list of selected delegates.

1. Basic Registration Fee: Rs. 350 (to be paid by all delegates including those attending the workshops).

2. Delegates who wish to attend the conference passively are required to pay Rs. 350 only. They get all the facilities stated below.

Registration Fee Includes:

- Delegate Kit

- Lunch (As mentioned in the event schedule)

- Delegate Certificate

- Opportunity to participate in competitions like Quiz, Debate, Photography, Painting, Essay writing for free.

- Witness the conference.
Participation in the events Case/Paper/Poster Presentations, Medical Short Films and Workshops are charged accordingly.

1. Workshop:



You can register for only one of the following three workshops.

- Basic Life Support Workshop fee: Rs. 2200

- Emergency obstetrics and Neonatology Workshop fee: Rs. 1000

- Basic Surgical Skills and ECG Workshop fee : Rs. 900


2. Paper presentation:

- Only Individual Paper Presentations are allowed.

- Fee: Rs. 250 per head.


3. Case presentation:

- In case of group presentation, both participants should register separately entering the same case title and details of the co-presenter. Only one delegate should upload the abstract.

- Fee: Rs. 250 per head.


4. Poster presentation:

- In case of group presentation, all participants should register separately entering the same poster topic and details of the co-presenters.

- Fee: Rs. 150 per head.


5. Medical Short Films:

- Only the Director of the film should register on behalf of the team.

- Fee: Rs. 200 per team.

1. All the delegates should register.

2. Basic registration Fee: Rs. 150 (to be paid by all delegates including those participating in paid events).

3. Basic Registration fee includes:
- Delegate Kit
- Lunch (on the day of the delegate's event)
- Delegate Certificate
- Opportunity to participate in Quiz, Medical dumb-charades, Essay writing for free.
- Witness the conference (On the day of the delegate's event).

1. MedTech:

- Only the Team Leader will pay the fee of Rs. 200 on behalf of the team. All team members should register separately (entering the same Project Title and Team Name).

- Fee: Rs. 200 per team.

2. Medical Short Films:

- Only the Director of the film should register on behalf of the team.

- Fee: Rs. 200 per team.
Participation in the events MedTech and Medical Short Films are charged accordingly.

1. This event includes research projects done by students of Medicine, Engineering, Biotechnology, BioMed and other related sciences.

2. It is open to undergraduate students of all years and graduates of 2014.

3. The projects should be demonstrable, medically related working models.

4. Both funded and non-funded projects will be accepted.

5. The model should be accommodated in 5*5 sq.ft. area at the conference.

6. Both individual and group (with a maximum of 4 members) presentations are welcome. The teams can include a medical student (Undergraduate) as a team member.

7. The students have to submit the project abstract [including introduction, principle, brief working of the model, emphasis on medical application, results, conclusion (advantages and drawbacks), future prospects and references] not exceeding 500 words as a .ppt file. It is mandatory to include the following in the file:

-. Certificate of approval either from the academic institution or organisation dealing with undergraduate projects.

-. Photo of the model with at least 1 participant sharing space in the same photo.

8. At the conference emphasis on medical explanation of the model is mandatory besides technical explanation.

9. The participants are requested to inform prior to the event, any requirements needed for the working of their model on the day of conference.

10. The time allotted for each team will be 6 min for explanation + 3 min for judges’ interaction.

11. In case of group presentation, all the delegates need to be involved in it.

Note:

1. Participants are requested to put up their models an hour before the start of the conference session (5th September).

2. At least one of the participants is requested to be present near their exhibit during breaks for queries by delegates/viewers.

3. Participants registering for MedTech (only) can attend other free events of the conference on 5th September only.

Exciting cash prizes to the winners along with participation certificate to all the participants will be awarded. The competition will be followed by an interesting workshop for all the participants irrespective of the order of merit.
